feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 29 at 4:41PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...HIGH RIVER LEVELS FROM WARM TEMPERATURES... Previous record heat has produced significant snowmelt in higher terrain. This has caused high water levels and near bankfull conditions in rivers and streams throughout Upper Lynn Canal. This includes the Chilkat, the Klehini, and Taiya Rivers. No flooding is expected, with levels slowly dropping through Friday from cooler
entry.cap:areaDesc: Haines Borough and Lynn Canal; Taiya Inlet and Klondike Highway

entry.summary: ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM THURSDAY TO 1 AM AKDT FRIDAY FOR HOT DRY AND WINDY CONDITIONS FOR THE MIDDLE KUSKOKWIM VALLEY... * Winds...South 10 to 20 mph with gusts up to 30 mph. * Timing...Hot, dry, and windy conditions are expected Thursday afternoon and evening.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 29 at 1:34PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLOODING FROM LAKE DRAINAGE NEAR NUIQSUT... A lake 23 miles west of Nuiqsut is expected to drain rapidly into Judy Creek and Fish Creek sometime in the next two weeks, impacting camps downstream. Water levels are expect to rise 2 to 6 feet over a 12 to 24 hour period once it releases.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 29 at 2:45PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Cooler and Breezy 4th of July Weekend... * Noticeably cooler temperatures at least 10-15 degrees below average are expected Sunday and Independence Day. Highs in the low 80s are possible in the lower valleys with upper-60s to low- 70s in Sierra valleys. This may feel like an abrupt change for many, especially in mountain communities.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Greater Lake Tahoe Area; Lassen-Eastern Plumas-Eastern Sierra Counties; Mono; Surprise Valley California

This is a special weather statement from the National Weather Service in Riverton. * WHAT...Potential for strong wind gusts of 45 to 55 mph due to showers and thunderstorms moving through the area. * WHERE...Natrona County, including Casper and Casper Mountain.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Casper Mountain; Natrona County Lower Elevations

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 29 at 3:06PM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Locally strong and gusty winds with showers and thunderstorms... This is a special weather statement from the National Weather Service in Riverton. * WHAT...Potential for strong wind gusts of 45 to 55 mph due to showers and thunderstorms moving through these locations. * WHERE...Sweetwater, southeast Fremont, and southwest Natrona
entry.cap:areaDesc: East Sweetwater County; Green Mountains and Rattlesnake Range
